newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold prices mixed, volume dives.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold prices mixed, volume dives.

text.p: Traded volume on the Istanbul gold exchange shrank to 1,490 kilos on Tuesday from Monday's record 2,570 kilos.
Gold closed unchanged in dollar terms at $351.00 per ounce and easier in lira terms at 1,439,800 lira per gram compared to 1,442,100 on Monday as the lira firmed slightly against the dollar.
"There was some physical demand though not as much as expected. Most of the day's trade was from banks registering imported gold on the exchange," one dealer said.
Bourse members must register imported gold on the exchange by selling and buying the gold themselves before they can sell it to non-member third parties in the free market.
The lira edged higher to 127,630 to the dollar from 127,650 on Monday.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,390 kilos -- took place in the morning session with 53.3 percent of trade in dollar terms.
